pgTitle: List of people executed in New York

rows.text: Murder of Albany County Constable Darius Quimby on 3 January 1791
Murder of his wife, Belinda (née Bailey) Hitchcock
Murder of his wife, Margaret Qua
John Black, Mahlon Christie, Isaac Kent, and George Orcote
4 June 1814 (other accounts indicate date was in the spring of 1812 or around New Year's Eve 1813)
Murders of Hugh Cameron and Alexander McGiffrey
"[K]illed a 'female' who had 'alienated her husband's affection'"; daughter of Abram Antoine [q.v.]
Charles Thompson and James Peters (aka Peterson)
Murder of his wife, Ann Becker
Murder of U.S. Rifle Corps Major Benjamin Birdsall
Murder of Schoharie County Deputy Sheriff William Huddleston
"[For] avenging the execution of his daughter Mary Antoine [q.v.] by murdering the man [John Jacobs] whose testimony hanged her."
Murder of his wife, Victorine Grunsig
Murder of his wife, Margaret Fitzgerald
Murder of Mrs. Mary E. Gregg
Murder of Ann McGirr (a.k.a. Ann Hopkins)
Murder of his wife, Sophie Stephens
Murder of his wife, Mary Ferris
Murder of his wife, Mary Wagner
Murder of Lucy McLoughlin (a.k.a. Kate Smith)
Murder of his uncle, Dr. Andrew Mead
William Thompson, William Ellis and Charles Weaver (a.k.a. Charles Weston)
Murder of his wife, Julia A. Merrick
Murder of Jane L. DeForest Hull
Murder of his wife, Maria Dichaco Balbo
Murder of George Reed, a fellow Elmira Reformatory inmate
Murder of mother-in-law, Maria Velindino Selta
Murder of his wife, Martha Clarke
Murder of her husband William Druse; last female to be hanged in the State of New York
Francis Asbury Hawkins, a.k.a. Ashbury Hawkins
Murder of his mother, Cynthia A. Hawkins, on 1 October 1887
Murder of Lyman Smith Weeks; last known hanging in the State of New York
Murder of Tillie Ziegler; first use of the electric chair in the world
Murder of one of his comrades
Murder of his wife, Helen Potts
Murder of his wife by poison
Murder of election reformer Robert Ross
Murder and dismemberment of William Guldensuppe
Murder of her daughter, Ida Place
Murder of Matthew Wilson during a bank robbery
Murder of Matthew Wilson during a bank robbery
Willis van Wormer, Frederick van Wormer, and Burton van Wormer (brothers)
Murder of their uncle, Peter Hallenbeck
Murders of Fred and Willis Onley, and Alice Ingerick
Filippo DeMarco, Angelo Giusto, Lorenzo Cali, Salvatore DeMarco and Vincenzo Cona
Murder of police officer Michael Lynch
Andrew Manco Execution of Andrew Manco
Murder; conspiracy to commit murder (of Herman "Beansie" Rosenthal)
Murder of his wife, Elizabeth Coyer
Murder of Anna Aumüller; Schmidt remains the only Roman Catholic priest ever executed for murder in the United States
Murder of Canadian soldier George Griffelns
John Emieleta and John Rys (a.k.a. Joseph Adams)
Murder and robbery of Lee Jong
Israel Fisher, Harry Dreitzer, and Isidore Helfant
Murders of Sorro Graziano and his wife, Mary
Murders of Sorro Graziano and his wife, Mary
Murder of John Perraton during robbery of Fedders Manufacturing company
Fred Carmosino, Nicholas Leonelli, and Ferdinand Mangiamele
Murder of police officer Frederick Hirsch
Tony Marino, Joseph Murphy, Francis Pasqua, and Daniel Kriesberg
June and July 1934 (exact dates not provided)
Vincent Saeta, Sam Faraci, and Anna Antonio
Kidnapping and murder of Grace Budd (confessed to killing other children)
Mary Frances Creighton and Everett Appelgate
Murder of Ada Appelgate (wife of Everett Appelgate)
Murders of Alfred Klausman and NYPD traffic officer Ed Maher
Murders of James Monti and Mrs. Delores Croyle
Murders of Helen Lynch and Margaret Lynch
Edward Kahkoska, Eugene Koberski, and Henry Suckow
Murders of Jack Hylands and Tony Marchisella
Murders of Janet Fay, Delphine Downing, and Rainelle Downing
Kidnapping and murder of Peter Weinberger, an infant
Murder of Joseph Friedman in a 1958 robbery
Murder and robbery. This was the last execution in New York prior to the death penalty being declared unconstitutional in New York.
